description: Let's have another look at our Handle and Rock elements. What we need for our slingshot, is a rubber strip.
First, we need a JavaScript class with a getter for the identification string (is).
The class will be a subclass of Polymer.Element which we won't forget to import (right?).
For this html implementation, let's use a strip image at "assets/images/strip.png".
We'll give it a property as well: side. This property is a string and it's default value is empty.
So, as a quick reminder: the location of Polymer.Element is "lib/polymer/polymer-element.html" and the image is located at "assets/images/strip.png". Good luck!
followUpMessage: Woohoo! Another one! Now, let's make an extra web component and tell some more about it!

minifiedJavaScriptSolutions: class RubberStrip extends Polymer.Element{static get is(){return'rubber-strip'}static get properties(){return{size:{type:String,value:''}}}}window.customElements.define(RubberStrip.is,RubberStrip)
class RubberStrip extends Polymer.Element{static get is(){return'rubber-strip'}static get properties(){return{size:{value:'',type:String}}}}window.customElements.define(RubberStrip.is,RubberStrip)
class RubberStrip extends Polymer.Element{static get properties(){return{size:{type:String,value:''}}}static get is(){return'rubber-strip'}}window.customElements.define(RubberStrip.is,RubberStrip)
